intro: Apinella lessingii, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including livestock. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Apinella lessingii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in desert ecosystems.
